page_analysis.text_content:
36

Driveway standards

• Driveway surfaces may have either
  permeable or impermeable paving.
  Materials shall meet Public Works
  standards.

• Driveway surface within 10' of the
  public right-of-way may not be of a
  loose material e.g., gravel.

• 2nd dwelling units must share com-
  mon driveway with main dwelling.

• Minimum driveway clearance: 10'

• Minimum driveway surface: 8'

• Minimum 20' between curb cuts.

• No more than 40% of required
  front yard may be impermeable.

• Street-work permit required for
  work done within the public right-
  of-way.

For safety reasons, the city also encourages
that the following standard be met:

• No more than one curb cut per single
  frontage.

• Minimum of 50' between curb cut and
  intersection curb face.

Fig 31 Driveway standards

Pavers without mortar
(grass between) OK

"Hollywood strips"
(grass between) OK

Gravel OK

Turns enroute to required
parking spaces must be
deemed manueverable by
the Transportation Division.

8' min. width for driveway
surface (typ. all)

10' min. width for driveway
clearance (typ. all)

10'
min

No gravel or similar loose
materials within 10' of the
public right-of-way (lot line)

Work done within the public
ROW requires a street-work
permit and must comply with
city standards.

visual_elements.description:
Figure 31, titled 'Driveway standards', illustrates three acceptable driveway surface types in a top-down view, showing their connection to a public sidewalk. 
1. 'Pavers without mortar (grass between) OK': Shows a driveway made of irregular stone pavers with grass growing in the gaps.
2. '"Hollywood strips" (grass between) OK': Shows two parallel, paved tire tracks with a strip of grass in the middle.
3. 'Gravel OK': Shows a gravel driveway with detailed annotations. A curved radius is shown where the driveway meets the property line. Callouts with leader lines point to various features: 
- A note about turns being maneuverable as deemed by the Transportation Division.
- An '8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all)' indicated with dimension lines.
- A '10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all)' indicated with dimension lines.
- A solid black section at the bottom of the gravel driveway, adjacent to the sidewalk, is marked with a '10' min' dimension and a note: 'No gravel or similar loose materials within 10' of the public right-of-way (lot line)'.
- A note indicating that work in the public Right-Of-Way (ROW) requires a street-work permit.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum impermeable area of required front yard
Maximum number of curb cuts per single frontage
Minimum distance between curb cut and intersection curb face
Number of dwelling units to share common driveway
Diagram - Minimum non-loose material distance from public right-of-way

additional_notes: Page number '36' is present in the bottom-left corner.
The overall layout is a main title, followed by three columns of bulleted lists, and a large annotated diagram occupying the bottom half of the page.
The text is organized into several sets of bullet points detailing regulations and recommendations.
cross_references: Materials shall meet Public Works standards.
Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed manueverable by the Transportation Division.
Work done within the public ROW requires a street-work permit and must comply with city standards.
